vulnerability_findings.name: use-nested-if
vulnerability_findings.message: Using nested is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-prefix-increment-not-postfix
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using the prefix increment expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix increment expression is cheaper in terms of gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(msg.sender == minter, "FuelToken:onlyMinter: should only be called by minter");
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: constant-function
vulnerability_findings.message: FuelToken.getChainId (FuelToken.sol#369-373) is declared view but contains assembly code

vulnerability_findings.name: incorrect-equality
vulnerability_findings.message:
FuelToken._writeCheckpoint (FuelToken.sol#335-346) uses a dangerous strict equality:
	- nCheckpoints > 0 && checkpoints[delegatee][nCheckpoints - 1].fromBlock == blockNumber

vulnerability_findings.name: assembly
vulnerability_findings.message:
FuelToken.getChainId uses assembly (FuelToken.sol#369-373)
	- FuelToken.sol#371

vulnerability_findings.name: pragma
vulnerability_findings.message:
Different versions of Solidity is used in FuelToken.sol:
	- Version used: ['ABIEncoderV2', '^0.5.16']
	- FuelToken.sol#4 declares pragma solidity^0.5.16
	- FuelToken.sol#5 declares pragma experimentalABIEncoderV2

        return _delegate(msg.sender, delegatee);
vulnerability_findings.message: FuelToken.delegate (FuelToken.sol#202-204) should be declared external
